Vulnerabilities: Sensitive information disclosure through comments in HTML and CSS files

Steps.Description: The attacker uses Dirb to bruteforce directories on the target website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that there might be hidden directories on the target website that contain sensitive information.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker runs Dirb with a wordlist against the target website to discover hidden directories.
StepDetails.Result: Dirb discovers the directory 'academic/developers/secrets/final.txt' on the target website.

Steps.Description: The attacker inspects the HTML source code of the target website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that there might be hidden information in the HTML source code.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker inspects the HTML source code of the target website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds the first part of the flag as a comment within the HTML source code.

Steps.Description: The attacker inspects the style.css file of the target website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that there might be hidden information in the style.css file.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker inspects the style.css file of the target website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds the second part of the flag as a comment in the style.css file.

Steps.Description: The attacker combines all the parts of the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that combining all the parts of the flag found in the previous steps will result in the full flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker combines the three parts of the flag to obtain the full flag.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker obtains the full flag.
